text: The Comunità montana Mont Emilius ("Mont Emilius mountain community" is an association of 10 comuni in the Italian region of Valle d'Aosta. The Comunità is named after the Monte Emilius mountain, a high mountain in the Graian Alps near the city of Aosta. ==Purpose== The Comunità was formed with very small communities that are at least partially in mountain regions in order to strengthen the economic development of the region and stop the rural-urban migration. Its main purpose is to promote the development of the valleys in the preservation of their cultural and environmental heritage. The Comunità also helps with technical assistance to all the comuni of the region. The main activities have been: * protection of alpine pastures (or Alpine tundra) * development of tourism ==Geography== This Comunità is in the central part of Valle d'Aosta, southeast east of Aosta, the capital city of the Valle d'Aosta. The Dora Baltea river flows through this Comunità. The area of the Comunità montana Mont Emilius is about . The population is 22,528;, so its population density is of inhabitants/km2. The headquarters of the mountain community are in Quart. The Comunità includes these comuni: Comuni Population (2013) Area (km²) Density (Inh./km²) 1 Brissogne 1,010 25.51 2 Charvensod 2,516 25.96 3 Fénis 1,796 68.28 4 Gressan 3,371 25.47 5 Jovençan 758 6.98 6 Nus 2,954 57.38 7 Pollein 1,568 15.41 8 Quart 3,921 62.32 9 Saint-Christophe 3,354 14.81 10 Saint-Marcel 1,280 42.24 ==References== ==Related pages== * Valle d'Aosta ==Other websites== * The National Union of Mountain Towns and Communities - UNCEM * Comuniverso: le 211 Comunità montane Category:Italian mountain communities
title: Comunità montana Mont Emilius
